intro: Kadsura, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It consists of several species, with Kadsura coccifera being the most well-known, native to East Asia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that appear in the spring. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Kadsura is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
